title: Medical School Practitioner Communication Skills Development Program Using Virtual Patient Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Knowledge and Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: A communication training program using virtual patient simulations in constrained technology environments (smartphone-centric). Scenario-based projects mirroring real clinical situations for current practitioners.

learning_goals: Learners can master and apply patient history-taking, empathetic responses, and information delivery skills at over 80% proficiency in a virtual patient simulation environment.
Learners can establish and implement collaborative communication strategies in complex clinical situations through PBL team projects
Learners can continuously improve communication skills through self/peer assessment after simulation activities

resources: Digital Portfolio System for Formative Assessment
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
